intro: Henckelia rufescens, commonly known as the red-bark tree, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its reddish bark, which becomes more pronounced with age, and its clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and arranged oppositely along the stems. Henckelia rufescens is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, well-drained soils.
